wwpy.header

This module contains the Header class for Window Weight (WW) file handling.

Classes

Header(if_, iv, ni, nr[, probid, nt, ne, ...])

A class representing the header information for a Window Weight (WW) file.
class Header(if_, iv, ni, nr, probid='', nt=<factory>, ne=<factory>, nfx=None, nfy=None, nfz=None, x0=None, y0=None, z0=None, ncx=None, ncy=None, ncz=None, nwg=None, x1=None, y1=None, z1=None, x2=None, y2=None, z2=None)[source]

Bases: object

A class representing the header information for a Window Weight (WW) file.

This class stores and manages various parameters that define the geometric mesh and particle properties for radiation transport calculations.

Parameters:

  • if (int) – File type indicator (currently only 1 is supported)

  • iv (int) – Time-dependent windows flag (1=no, 2=yes)

  • ni (int) – Number of particle types

  • nr (int) – Mesh type indicator (10=rectangular, 16=cylindrical/spherical)

  • probid (str) – Problem identification string, defaults to “”

  • nt (List[int]) – Number of time bins per particle type

  • ne (List[int]) – Number of energy bins per particle type

  • nfx (Optional[float]) – Total number of fine mesh bins in x/r direction

  • nfy (Optional[float]) – Total number of fine mesh bins in y/z/theta direction

  • nfz (Optional[float]) – Total number of fine mesh bins in z/theta/phi direction

  • x0 (Optional[float]) – Origin x-coordinate or radial reference point

  • y0 (Optional[float]) – Origin y-coordinate or axial reference point

  • z0 (Optional[float]) – Origin z-coordinate or angular reference point

  • ncx (Optional[float]) – Number of coarse mesh bins in x/r direction

  • ncy (Optional[float]) – Number of coarse mesh bins in y/z/theta direction

  • ncz (Optional[float]) – Number of coarse mesh bins in z/theta/phi direction

  • nwg (Optional[float]) – Geometry type (1=cartesian, 2=cylindrical, 3=spherical)

  • x1 (Optional[float]) – X-component of first reference vector

  • y1 (Optional[float]) – Y-component of first reference vector

  • z1 (Optional[float]) – Z-component of first reference vector

  • x2 (Optional[float]) – X-component of second reference vector

  • y2 (Optional[float]) – Y-component of second reference vector

  • z2 (Optional[float]) – Z-component of second reference vector

  • if_ (int)

Variables:

  • has_time_dependency (bool) – Indicates if the window weights are time-dependent

  • type_of_mesh (Optional[str]) – Returns the type of mesh geometry being used

  • number_of_time_bins (List[int]) – List of time bins for each particle type

  • number_of_energy_bins (List[int]) – List of energy bins for each particle type

  • number_of_particle_types (int) – Total number of particle types

property has_time_dependency: bool

Check if the window weights have time dependency.

Returns:

True if window weights are time-dependent (iv=2), False otherwise

Return type:

bool

property type_of_mesh: str | None

Get the type of mesh geometry being used.

Returns:

String indicating mesh type (‘cartesian’, ‘cylindrical’, ‘spherical’), ‘unknown’ for invalid values, or None if nwg is not set

Return type:

Optional[str]

Example:
>>> header = Header(...)
>>> header.nwg = 1
>>> header.type_of_mesh
'cartesian'
property number_of_time_bins: List[int]

Get the list of time bins for each particle type.

Returns:

List containing the number of time bins for each particle type

Return type:

List[int]

property number_of_energy_bins: List[int]

Get the list of energy bins for each particle type.

Returns:

List containing the number of energy bins for each particle type

Return type:

List[int]

property number_of_particle_types: int

Get the total number of particle types.

Returns:

Number of particle types defined in the window weights

Return type:

int
